thread.title: 2 Vancouver teens in stolen car arrested after chase, officials say
thread.title_full: 2 Vancouver teens in stolen car arrested after chase, officials say | OregonLive.com

author: Luke Hammill | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: 2 Vancouver teens in stolen car arrested after chase, officials say
text:
Two Vancouver teenagers in a stolen car found themselves under arrest after being chased by law enforcement, the Clark County Sheriff's Office announced Friday.
Zachary M. Foulke, 19, and Larry Ruben Joy, 18, were booked into the Clark County Jail on charges of attempting to elude and possession of a stolen vehicle, officials said.
A sheriff's deputy noticed a blue Honda Civic that had been reported as driving recklessly on St. Johns Road, authorities said, and dispatchers confirmed that it was stolen out of Vancouver. The deputy tried to stop the vehicle; it slowed down, and Joy, the passenger, jumped out and ran away, the sheriff's office said.
The vehicle then "took off at a high rate of speed," officials said.
The deputy chased Joy and arrested him after a brief foot chase, and another deputy cornered the vehicle with the help of Vancouver police on Northeast 40th Street, authorities said. Foulke was then arrested.
-- Luke Hammill
